name: Microsoft Office 365 - 70-346 (2017)
subtitle: Managing Office 365 Identities and Requirements
description: Office 365 is a cloud based productivity suite for individuals, companies and even government agencies. It is designed to deliver software as service to any and every user regardless of location. The Office 365 solution is designed to relieve the technical challenge of software management and delivery, regardless of location from the local IT personnel. This allows the IT professional to focus in implementing, deploying and operating Office 365 services and administrating supporting technologies, like email, collaboration and storage. If you’re an IT professional who takes part in evaluating, planning, deploying, and operating the Office 365 services, including its dependencies, requirements, and supporting technologies this series will demonstrate and help you to see what is involved in setting up Office 365 for your organization.
descriptionMD: Office 365 is a cloud based productivity suite for individuals, companies and even government agencies. It is designed to deliver software as service to any and every user regardless of location. The Office 365 solution is designed to relieve the technical challenge of software management and delivery, regardless of location from the local IT personnel. This allows the IT professional to focus in implementing, deploying and operating Office 365 services and administrating supporting technologies, like email, collaboration and storage. If you’re an IT professional who takes part in evaluating, planning, deploying, and operating the Office 365 services, including its dependencies, requirements, and supporting technologies this series will demonstrate and help you to see what is involved in setting up Office 365 for your organization.

episodes.title: Overview
episodes.description: a

episodes.title: Provision Office365 Tenants
episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie introduce how to setup an Office 365 tenant. They introduce the basic tenant provision steps.  They review the best practices for tenant account provisioning.

episodes.title: Provision Office365 Tenants Pt2
episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie continue with the Office 365 setup.  They show the initial Global Administrator account and assign some subscription.  They add an additional user and make the user a different type of administrator for the tenant.  Lastly they show where the billing can be seen and talk about handling licensing issues.

episodes.title: Configure for New Features
episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie use the Office 365 Admin Center to configure the tenant for new features and updates.  They describe the use and show where to configure these settings for the tenant.  They remind us that this only affects software that has been downloaded with those settings not software setup with different settings.

episodes.title: Add and Configure Custom Domain
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie explain some basic DNS concepts to help setup Office 365 to work with a Custom Domain Name. They describe how to add a custom domain name and work with DNS records to make it work with Office 365.

episodes.title: Add and Configure Custom Domain Part 2
episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie explain some basic DNS concepts to help setup Office 365 to work with a Custom Domain Name. They describe how to add a custom domain name and work with DNS records to make it work with Office 365.

episodes.title: Pilot Users and Workloads
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Zach explore what it takes to plan a pilot.  They provide an overview of the steps to get a pilot started.  They discuss the types of users who should be included in it. Also, they talk about some of the workloads that do not need to be migrated.  Lastly, they demonstrate the use of a tool that tests the Health, Readiness and Connectivity.

episodes.title: Run Idfix
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Zach show the use of IdFix.  They discuss the reason to use IdFix and its importance if you have an on-premises AD and want to use directory sychronization.  Lastly, they also discuss creating a basic test plan

episodes.title: Setup Email for Pilot User
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Zach demonstrate the steps to setting up email for Pilot Users. They show each step and  discuss what must be considered for a successful pilot to take place.

episodes.title: Engage Fasttrack Center for Office
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to get the help of the FastTrack Center to onboard Office 365 services.

episodes.title: Enable Client Connectivity
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss and show how to enable client connectivity to Office 365. They review the records that need to be added to the DNS registrar for email, communication and collaboration to work. Also they focus in on configurations on proxy and firewall to access Office 365 Keywords: dns,srv records, ns records, mx records, srv records, firewall settings, proxy settings.

episodes.title: Administer Azure Rights Management
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to manage rights management through Azure. They demonstrate how to activate it and assign roles for rights management.

episodes.title: Administer Azure Rights Management Pt2
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to manage rights management through Azure. They use powershell to begin some management configuration of admnistrators and super user too.

episodes.title: Administer Azure Rights Management Pt3
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to manage rights management through Azure.  They use powershell to begin some management configuration of admnistrators and super user too.

episodes.title: Manage Office 365 Administrator Roles
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie examine the different admin roles in Office 365. They also show configure those roles in the admin center and PowerShell.

episodes.title: Manage Passwords and Users
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to manage users and passwords. They configure the password management for the tenant. Also they discuss and demonstrate how to manage user groups and bulk add users too.

episodes.title: Manage Passwords and Users Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to manage users and passwords.  They configure the password management for the tenant.  Also they discuss and demonstrate how to manage user groups and bulk add users too.

episodes.title: Manage Passwords and Users Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie help us to get started using MFA on our Office 365 accounts to better protect our authentication process.  They discuss the benefits and issues using MFA for authentication

episodes.title: Cloud Identities with PowerShell
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie talk about managing identities with powershell.  They emphasize the use of powershell in configuring passwords, creating bulk user accounts with CSV files, user account management such as licensing management and deleting accounts one at a time or in bulk.

episodes.title: Azure Active Directory Cmdlets
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review some of the Azure AD cmdlets.  These commands require connecting to Office 365 and or Azure AD.  They review multiple cmdlets to help with user management, group management, service principal management, domain management and administrative unit management.

episodes.title: Azure Active Directory Cmdlets Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review some of the Azure AD cmdlets.  These commands require connecting to Office 365 and or Azure AD.  They review multiple cmdlets to help with user management, group management, service principal management, domain management and administrative unit management.

episodes.title: Create Security Groups
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to create security groups in Office 365.  They demonstrate creating, editing and deleting a security group using the admin center interface and using the powershell connection to do so.

episodes.title: Prepare AD Synchronization to O365
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss integration of on-premises Active Directory and Azure Active Directory.

episodes.title: Prepare AD Synchronization to O365 Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss integration of on-premises Active Directory and Azure Active Directory.

episodes.title: Plan for Filtering Active Directory
episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Zach take a look at fitering Active Directory. They cover various types of filtering such as group-based, domain-based, OU-based and attribute-based filtering.

episodes.title: Plan for Filtering Active Directory Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Zach take a look at fitering Active Directory. They cover various types of filtering such as group-based, domain-based, OU-based and attribute-based filtering.

episodes.title: Plan for Filtering Active Directory Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Zach take a look at fitering Active Directory. They cover various types of filtering such as group-based, domain-based, OU-based and attribute-based filtering.

episodes.title: Set Up Azure AD Connect Tool
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the best practices when setting up the Azure AD Connect Tool. They also review the prerequisites to make the AD Connect Tool work

episodes.title: Set Up Azure AD Connect Tool Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show the connection steps and discuss the setup for the Azure AD Connect Tool to work.  They show the synchronization and then show some of the different considerations after the AD Connect Tool is in place and ready to go

episodes.title: Set Up Azure AD Connect Tool Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show the connection steps and discuss the setup for the Azure AD Connect Tool to work.  They show the synchronization and then show some of the different considerations after the AD Connect Tool is in place and ready to go

episodes.title: Set Up Azure AD Connect Tool Part 4
episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie show the connection steps and discuss the setup for the Azure AD Connect Tool to work.  They show the synchronization and then show some of the different considerations after the AD Connect Tool is in place and ready to go

episodes.title: Plan AD FS Requirements
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss how to prepare and plan for implementation of ADFS for our connection to Office 365.  They describe what it does for us and why we need it.  Lastly, they also discuss what are some of the elements that we must have together before we begin implementing it for our Office 365 environment.

episodes.title: Install and Manage AD FS Server
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie begin with the basic installation requirements and install the ADFS server for use.  After completing the installation and post-configuration, they use the Azure AD Connect tool to complete and verify ADFS is working correctly.

episodes.title: Install Web Access Proxy
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the use and need of the Web Access Proxy Server for the SSO.  They talk about some of the additional prequisites to allow it work.  They also describer how users from outside of our domain will use the web access proxy.

episodes.title: Install Web Access Proxy Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie take a moment to install the Web Access Proxy role and configure it's certificate to work.

episodes.title: Configure Web Access Proxy
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie walk through the post-installation configuration for the proxy

episodes.title: Customize ADFS Sign-in Page
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to customize the ADFS Sign-In-Page. This allows O365 admins to customize the end-user experience for their needs, according to the team. They describe many options that can be changed and demonstrate how to change some of them using powershell.

episodes.title: Analyze Reports and Monitor Service Health
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie demonstrate some of the different methods to get information about the past history and current health of the O365 tenant. They show where you can find reports within the 0365 portal and used the Service Health Dashboard.

episodes.title: Isolate Service Interruption
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show some of the different methods to isolate Service Interruption.  They show some of the different tools available for the admin monitoring the O365.

episodes.title: Disabling AD Federation
episodes.description: n this episode, Zach and Ronnie demonstrate some of the steps necessary when you disable adfs and keep password synchonization running.

episodes.title: Disabling AD Federation Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie demonstrate some of the steps necessary when you disable adfs and keep password synchonization running.

episodes.title: Document and Email Protection
episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss rights managements basics. They discuss the problems that companies face protecting email and documents.  Then, they discuss how Rights Managment provides a solution for protecting our data, regardless of who receives the data, where it resides and technology available.

topics.title: Manage Identities with Azure Active Directory Connect
Implement and Manage Federated Identities for SSO
Monitor and troubleshoot Office 365 availability and usage
